page.title: 14Entertainment
page.content: Crail Children's Orchestra and Choir.was founded in 1982 and the present membership consists of 40 children aged from 5 to 15. The under 7's get singing,percussion and recorders. The 9,s and over do choral work, recorders and full orchestral instruments. The annual summer concert consists of orchestral, choral and dramatic stagework. Concerts given for charity. Annual carol concert in Crail Church. A new opera 'The Fifer of Fife' specially commissioned for choir and orchestra tells the story of local ghost legend of Balcomie Castle. Professional singers and instrumentalists take the lead roles. An association of Friends was formed early 85 to raise financial support. 'Crail Kirk Junior Singers' contribute to the fellowship of the Church.
